text: Expression of Proinflammatory Cytokines Was Elevated in Nrf2 Knockout Astrocytes after Scratch Injury

As we all know , TNF-alpha , <extra_id_0> IL-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> are regulated by NF-kappaB and reflect the endogenous activity of NF-kappaB .
It has been revealed that these proinflammatory cytokines are increased after TBI in animals [ 2 , 8 ] .
And our previous study has proved that higher levels of such proinflammatory cytokines were observed in the brain of Nrf2 - deficient mice after TBI [ 5 ] .
But it is still ambiguous about the relationship between these cytokines and Nrf2 in astrocytes after TBI .

Here , we tested the levels of TNF-alpha , <extra_id_0> IL-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in cultured astrocytes at 24 h after scratch injury by RT-PCR and ELISA .

It was shown that the mRNA levels of TNF-alpha , <extra_id_0> IL-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> were increased after scratch in both WT and KO astrocytes when compared with their sham counterparts , respectively .

Moreover , the mRNA levels of these cytokines in group KO TBI were much higher than those in group WT TBI ( 1.66 +/- 0.085 versus 1.39 +/- 0.110 for TNF-alpha , 1.34 +/- 0.064 versus 0.73 +/- 0.088 for <extra_id_0> IL-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and 1.28 +/- 0.102 versus 0.99 +/- 0.073 for <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
The results of ELISA revealed that the protein level of TNF-alpha was upregulated after scratch injury in WT and KO astrocytes when compared with their sham counterparts .
And it was also higher in group KO TBI than in group WT TBI ( 3.67 +/- 0.156 versus 2.31 +/- 0.087 , P < 0.01 ) ( Figure 4 ( a ) ) .
Similar tendency was observed in protein level of <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> IL-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
For <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , it was 36.07 +/- 0.786 for group KO TBI while 25.76 +/- 0.536 for group WT TBI ( P < 0.01 ) ( Figure 4 ( b ) ) .
For <extra_id_0> IL-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , it was 190.75 +/- 6.339 for group KO TBI while 154.50 +/- 5.348 for group WT TBI ( P < 0.01 ) ( Figure 4 ( c ) ) .
